info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 2:29PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY THROUGH 300 PM MDT... At 229 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Frijoles, or 10 miles southwest of Los Alamos, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bandelier National Monument, Cochiti Lake, Frijoles and Cochiti Pueblo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
